升.definition: to ascend; to rise; to promote; to elevate; liter; unit of dry measure for grain (= one liter or one-tenth dou 斗[dou3])

升上.definition: (of an employee) to be promoted to (a higher rank); (of a student) to enter (a higher grade at school)

升值.definition: to rise in value; to appreciate

升堂入室.definition: lit. to reach the main room and enter the chamber (idiom); fig. to gradually attain proficiency; to attain a higher level

升壓.definition: to boost the pressure (of a fluid); to boost (or step up) the voltage

升天.definition: lit. to ascend to heaven; to die

升學.definition: to enter the next grade school

升官發財.definition: to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)

升幅.definition: extent of an increase; percentage rise

升斗.definition: liter and decaliter dry measure; (fig.) meager quantity of foodstuff

升斗小民.definition: (idiom) poor people; those who live from hand to mouth

升旗.definition: to raise a flag; to hoist a flag

升溫.definition: to become hot; temperature rise; (fig.) to intensify; to hot up; to escalate; to get a boost

升班馬.definition: (sports, esp. soccer) newly promoted team (one that has advanced from a lower league to a higher league)

升空.definition: to rise to the sky; to lift off; to levitate; liftoff

升級.definition: to go up by one grade; to be promoted; to escalate (in intensity); (computing) to upgrade

升結腸.definition: ascending colon (anatomy); first section of large intestine

升職.definition: to get promoted (at work etc); promotion

升華.definition: to sublimate; sublimation (physics); to raise to a higher level; to refine; promotion

升調.definition: to promote to a higher post; (linguistics) rising intonation; (Chinese linguistics) rising tone

升起.definition: to raise; to hoist; to rise

升遷.definition: to advance to a higher-level position; to be promoted to a higher position in a new department

升降機.definition: aerial work platform (e.g. cherry picker or scissor lift); lift; elevator

升騰.definition: to rise; to ascend; to leap up
